Pre-Game Insights: Croatia vs Poland is next in the UEFA Nations League A Group 1 this Sunday.
The Opus Arena in Osijek will be energized to see the hosts grab all three points against the visiting Polish.
Croatia has established itself as a footballing powerhouse but is now seeing new faces in the team.
Croatia will be determined to lift the 2024–25 UEFA Nations League for their legend Modric.
The recent 2-1 defeat to Portugal has added more pressure on Croatia to win the remaining two fixtures against Poland and Scotland.
Poland may not be under the same pressure of winning major international competitions but has always been a footballing nation that qualifies for the World Cups and the European Championships.
Poland started UEFA Nations League League A Group 1 with a win against Scotland, winning 3-2.
Despite Portugal being the clear favorites to win the group, Poland could change the story with a win on Sunday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two sides have very little history between them, meeting just five times, with one official match and the other four being friendly games.
In the group stage of UEFA Euro 2008, Croatia won 1-0 against Poland.
Last two H2H results: 2008/06/17- Poland 0-1 Croatia, 2006/06/03- Croatia 0-1 Poland.
Others: Croatia National Football Team News: Luka Modric with his teammates during a clash against Portugal.
Croatia, looking for their first win in five games, may change their roster this weekend.

After Domagoj Vida and midfielder Marcelo Brozovic retired from international action, Josip Stanisic and Martin Erlic were both ruled out of this month’s training due to injuries, while Duje Caleta-Car has been suffering with fitness.
Poland National Football Team News: Poland stars celebrating a win against Scotland in the Nations League.

Robert Lewandowski is leading a team without long-serving players Wojciech Szczesny and Kamil Grosicki, the latter of whom has retired from football altogether, and his injured striking partner Arkadiusz Milik.
Adam Buksa is an alternate possibility, although Krzysztof Piatek, who has been playing well in the Turkish Super Lig, partnered with his captain in attack the previous game.
In the absence of Szczesny, goalkeeper Marcin Bulka will start in goal.
Croatia National Football Team Predicted Lineup: Livakovic; Jakic, Sutalo, Gvardiol, Sosa; Modric, Kovacic, L. Sucic; Pasalic, Kramaric, Ivanusec.
Poland National Football Team Predicted Lineup: Bulka; Bednarek, Dawidowicz, Kiwior; Frankowski, Zielinski, Szymanski, Moder, Zalewski; Piatek, Lewandowski.
The game will be a fierce battle between both sides, but looking at current results Poland could come out as the winner.
Betting Tips and Odds: Croatia win – 1.67, Poland win – 3.90, Draw – 4.80.
Where to watch Croatia vs Poland Live: India - Sony Network/SonyLiv, UK - Sky Sports, USA - ESPN, Croatia - DAZN, Poland - DAZN.
